DataElement.preferredName: Malignant Neoplasm Metastatic Involvement Anatomic Site Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Free text field to specify the anatomic location where evidence is detected for spread of cancer from a tumor composed of atypical neoplastic cells to another part of the body that is not already specified or mentioned.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to evidence of the spread of cancer from a tumor composed of atypical neoplastic cells to another part of the body.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues.  Malignant neoplasms usually metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision.  The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas (adenocarcinomas or squamous cell carcinomas), Hodgkin's and non-Hodgkin's lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas. -- 2004

Concepts.definition: A neoplasm composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas, Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.

Property.preferredDefinition: (MET-uh-STAT-ik) Having to do with metastasis, which is the spread of cancer from one part of the body to another.:To have a connection by participation or association or use; sharing in an activity or process.

Concepts.definition: A term referring to the clinical or pathologic observation of a tumor extension from its original site of growth to another anatomic site.
To have a connection by participation or association or use; sharing in an activity or process.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: indication of the presence and extent of disease.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: revised to provide naming consistency for related elements

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Descriptive text indicating site of metastasis.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Named locations of, or within, the body.:Text; the words of something written.

Concepts.definition: Named locations of or within the body.

ValueDomain.origin: CAP PROTOCOLS:College of American Pathologists Cancer Protocols

DataElement.changeDescription: Curated for The Cancer Genome Atlas (TCGA) by request of T. Lichenberg (JP) 12/2010. Modified definition to replace system generated with human readable format per approval by Tara. mc 7/2/11
